trans-unit.source: Provides an abstract definition of an action supported by the XML Web service.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> class corresponds to the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) `operation` element enclosed by the `portType` element.
For more information about WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref> class.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtensionCollection"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtensionCollection"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref>.
Gets the collection of faults, or error messages, defined by the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref>.
A collection of faults, or error messages, defined by the current operation.

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationBinding"></xref> matches with the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationBinding"></xref> to be checked to determine whether it matches with the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref>.
`true` if the instance matches the operationBinding parameter; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the collection of instances of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Message"></xref> class defined by the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref>.

Because an <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> is associated with exactly one <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationInput> and exactly one <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationOutput>, only one instance of each can be a member of this collection, and thus the collection can have a maximum of two members.
The collection of instances of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Message"></xref> class defined by the current <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref>.
Gets or sets an array of the elements contained in the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.ParameterOrderString"></xref>.

The elements of this array are identical to those of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.ParameterOrderString%2A> property, but housed in an array rather than a space-delimited string.
An array of names of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart"></xref> instances.
Gets or sets an optional Remote Procedure Call (RPC) signature that orders specification for request-response or solicit-response operations.
The named <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> instances must adhere to the following rules:

The order of the named <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> instances reflects the order of the parameters in the RPC (remote procedure call) signature, which is the name of the operation, its input and output parameters, the results it returns and the exceptions it might be asked to handle.
The return value is not present in the list.
If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> name appears in both the input and output messages, it is an `in/out` parameter.
If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> name appears only in the input message, it is an `in` parameter.
If the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> name appears only in the output message, it is an `out` parameter.
Note that this parameter list is not required, even if the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> is to be used with an RPC-style <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Binding>.
Do not call <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.ParameterOrderString%2A> directly.
This method is only used internally for XML serialization.
To return the parameter list use <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.ParameterOrder%2A>.
A list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart"></xref> instances separated by a single space.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.PortType"></xref> of which the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.Operation"></xref> is a member.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.PortType"></xref> object.
